Reviews.Title: Great small camera loaded with features!!
Reviews.Author: S. Welsh
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera with alot of fun features. I had a hard time deciding between the s8100 and the s6100 because the s8100 takes faster pictures, 1080 video, a better sensor, and bigger zoom.The features listed below are the reasons I chose the s6100.Touch screen--can use your finger but it can be a little tricky to move it just right.  It does come with a stylus that allows you to move through the screens quickly. Makes it very easy to get through the menus.  The menu on the left has the options for flash, self-timer, macro, and exposure compensation.  The menu on the bottom has the options for touch shutter, image mode, movie options, and settings. The battery levels are always displayed in the left hand corner so there is no guessing how much battery is left.  Above that the scene mode is displayed.Scene selection--There are 19 scenes to choose from plus the scene auto selector.  When you push the scene button and all 20 options are listed there is a question mark box in the upper right hand corner that will explain the different modes to help you choose the right one.Filter Effects--It has the ability to draw or write on photos, add decorations, cross screen, fish eye, selective color, black and white, sepia.  I have messed around with a few of these features, I will try to upload a few pictures.  It also has glamour retouch and skin softening.Playback button--Has options to star a photo as favorite, delete, slide show, protect, print, draw, retouch, voice record, and settings.Charger--This camera can charge through your computer or it also has an adapter much like most cell phones now do so you can use the USB cord to charge using an outlet.  There is a light on the back that flashes to let you know it is charging.The dedicated movie button makes it very simple to record videos. Unlike the 8100, you cannot take a photo while you are recording with the 6100.From the opinion of a hobby photographer, I think there are alot of features nicely packaged into this pocket-sized camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: stepheroni090
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera while looking for a small yet high quality point and shoot style camera.  This camera has great features in a small enough package to bring on the go.  The optical zoom works wonderfully.  Touch-Panel LCD is a nice feature.Only complaint I have with the camera is the image review after taking a picture lasts a seemingly long time. If you are trying to take multiple pictures quickly it can be annoying as the previous image takes up the screen so you can't preview your next picture.  Also, the touch-panel LCD isn't as responsive as you'd like it to be, but if you use the included stylus on the wrist strap it works just fine.  Just don't expect iPod Touch-quality responsiveness.Bottom line:Purchase this camera if you are looking for a point and shoot camera with good features, optical zoom, and a decent MegaPixel rating that come in a small package.

Reviews.Title: There must be better cameras
Reviews.Author: pfe
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for 3-months and waited until now to write a review because it was a gift and I really wanted to like this camera. But the more I've used it the less I like it. To be fair, it can take a descent picture under optimal conditions if you are careful, but so can a 1968 Kodak Brownie in the right hands. I really expected more from Nikon and modern electronic technology.Let me give you a little more background... I'm 63 years old and I've been taking pictures since I was 8 years old. Last winter I suffered a stroke which affected the coordination in my left hand and I found it difficuly to operate my Nikon D50 SLR. My wife, trying to be nice to me bought an S6100 for my birthday because she assumed that a point-and-shoot would be easier and less frustrating for me to use than my D50 SLR. I was excited to get it and try it out. The Nikon S6100 was smaller, lighter and easier to carry. As far as being easier to use,it is NOT! A person would expect an automatic point-and-shoot camera to be just that, point it, press the shutter release and get a fair picture most of the time. That's something this camera can't do with any regularity. A pox on Nikons house for the damn touch screen controls! Why have a touch screen shutter release function that duplicates the function of the shutter release button? While you try to hold the camera with your right hand you are almost forced to touch the screen while trying to frame the image and push the "real button". This more often than not activates the shutter resulting in a picture of the ground, your pant leg, or shoe. Then while you wait for the exceedingly slow electronics to store that image on the memory card, you miss several oportunities to try for a good shot. Would that this was the only problem with the touch screen. Nikon designed this cameras controls so the ONLY way to control various camera functions is through a menu system controlled using the touch screen. If that were not bad enough the screen itself is not sensitive enough to respond well to a finger touch unless you use a long finger nail or the little stylus hung on the wrist strap. This almost insures that you can't make any sort of quick option changes while you try to shoot. You may wonder if that screen does anything else. Yes, it shows a fairly bright image to use as a viewfinder or to review pictures of your shoes taken by mistake. Of course it is constantly smugged and dirty because you have to be touching it all the time.How about the overall function? The S6100 is as functional as most of it's competitors in the crowded point-and-shoot field. It's a snapshot camera at best loaded with difficult to control features and totally unecessary post shooting editing functions that are much better done on your computer after you download the pictures. I expected better from Nikon and I certainly thought that a 16 megapixel sensor would capture better quality shots. Again I was disappointed. My 6 megapixel D50 captures better images and it's over 5-years old. In anything other than optimal light, the automatic functions of the S6100 bump up the ISO a few clicks and once that's happened the image quickly gets grainy without gaining good exposure. Again I sure expected better from the newer class of sensors and software. The S6100 can also take Quicktime movies with a single press of the movie button on the back. This would be a nice function if the movie button were not small  placed directly below the right side thumb grip, almost ensuring that you will take some short movies you didn't want, again usually of the ground, your shoe, or the sky.Oh, and then there is battery life. Not too good. I can get maybe 200 shots and a short movie before the "battery exhausted" message pops up on the screen, and then you are done since the only way to recharge it is to plug the whole camera into the charger or a computer USB port, you will be out of luck in the field unless you invest in a second battery, keep it charged and in your pocket while you'r out shooting.Do you think I've been be too negative about the S6100?Here are the good things about it:1. It's small, light, and fits easily in a shirt pocket or purse2. The zoom lens is Nikon, and they do make the best optics and the wide to full zoom is all you will probably ever need.3. When you manage to get a snap shot it's usually of adequate quality, at least for your family album.MY RECOMMEDATIONS:If you want a point-and shoot Nikon, check out the S8100 or S9100, both much better cameras at only a slightly higher price.If you want great pictures and care about control of your camera functions get a Digital SLR and learn how to use it.If you want a touch screen get a smart phone. Most of those will take pictures and movies too, and might be easier to use than this camera, plus when you get frustrated with the smugged up touch screen, at least you can use it to call someone who cares.

Reviews.Title: great mid level point and shoot
Reviews.Author: mg
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about 4 hours now, so I am obviously a professional here.  But I am amazed at this camera.  I'll try and keep it short.  The camera pictures are great indoors, great outdoors, great macro, good 7x opti zoom, Good white balance, great low light.  Functionally, it is a simple interface, fast start to shoot time about 2-3 seconds, no noticeable shutter lag, flash is good for very short range, poor after about 7-10 feet and tends to not illuminate the entire photo, unless subject is very close.Unless you are well schooled in SLR cameras, this will take as close to a perfect photo within a near range of subjects.  If you want to zoom in on a players nose hairs from the balcony of the stadium, this camera will not do it.  If you want to photograph your kids in normal light to dusk at 1-60 feet away.  I don't believe you could improve upon this camera.  I have not used it in bright outdoor light yet, so no opinion there.  Unless you need a stronger zoom or flash, you cannot go wrong with this camera.  It is simple fast and takes near magazine quality photos.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste you money!!!
Reviews.Author: Darren O'Hooligan "Darren O'Hooligan"
Reviews.Content: We have a Sony DSC-W100 and after vacationing with some friends decided we need a new camera. The Sony had some REALLY bad shutter lag, therefore causing us to miss shots. After using a friends Kodak, i realized that my 7 year old camera was not cutting it. I spent weeks deciding what P&S; camera to buy. The catch is I didn't want to spend over $200. I have a Nikon DSLR so naturally i looked at Nikons first. I did look at Fuji, Sony, cannon (i know i know) Kodak and Olympus. Not being in the camera market for years, i was amazed at how things have changed so much. I'm accustomed to my SLR and was not willing to give up much. My old Sony has quasi-manual settings, and great control over the camera for a P&S.; After looking at the s4100, i noticed that there was too much shutter lag. I then looked at a cannon, and thought this is the one. For some reason I kept gravitation towards Nikon. Then, I found an absolute steal on the s6100 so decided to go for it. Right out of the box, the Nikon was ready to go (after a full charge of the battery). Downside is there is no physical manual. What am I supposed to read in the bathroom?? This is a very common occurrence with almost all electronics nowadays. Besides, it's good for the environment. Being a "tech geek" who needs a manual anyways, isn't that was playing around is for?? My first impression of the camera was very positive. Lightweight, very fast start up time, and ready to go (in daylight). The touchscreen is very easy to use overall use is very intuitive, however might be too much for a first time digital camera user. Picture quality is amazing. DPI at full resolution (why would you do anything else?)is at 200. Compare that to my old sony which was 72 dpi. Higher quality and resolution. There are 3 shooting modes. One is automatic. This mode is pretty self explanatory. Now move to the scene mode shooting. Here's where this camera really shines for me. I took a low light picture in auto mode, then switched to scene mode and selected " scene auto selector" The second picture in auto scene selector was MUCH better. I'm not sure which scene it chose but the background as well as foreground were lit properly. Something not achievable on my Sony... EVER. I'm used to being able to light a scene properly with my SLR and external strobe, so I was impressed. Something else that turned me on to the s6100 instead of the s8100 was the static flash. I know it's a minor complaint, but it's less moving pieces for me to worry about. Then theres' the tracking mode. Touch something on the screen (providing it stays still long enough for the camera to lock in) and it tracks the subject. Great for kids moving around! IT has many more features such as blink detect, face recognition and even a touch of the screen shutter mode. Movie mode has a continual focus mode and the ability to zoom in and out, all while recording in 720p HI DEF!! Granted the s8100 does record in full 1080P. I don't use the video mode enough to care to be honest. An to top it all off, it includes a full version of Nikon View NX2 which is a great importing and light editing program. It also includes a file transfer program as well. Absolute seamless integration with windows 7! The size is perfect. Small enough for a pocket, and to be taken anywhere and not be a burden. While still feeling substantial in your hand. 3 weeks later and I still love this camera and it's ability to take great pictures. The only thing i really gave up with the s8100 is 3x more zoom, and full 1080p recording. For the money I paid for the camera I couldn't be happier.Pros: Picture Quality. Ability to take great pictures on low light. 16mp at 200dpi at full resolution. Size. Fast start up. Very little shutter lag if any. Nikon view NX2. Seamless integration with windows 7.  Ease of use.Cons. 7x zoom instead of 10x. only 720p in video mode. No flash compensation for low light situations or zoom.Update: I'm not sure exactly what I was thinking when I wrote this review but after using this camera for a while, this camera ended up being a huge waste of money. This camera took great pictures in daylight, but in low light situations this camera failed miserably. The final draw was a missed picture of my son and his cousins on the back of a fire truck and could not take a picture no matter what I did. Granted it did take some good pictures at times, but after upgrading to a new sony, I really got an idea on how bad this camera really is. so bad in fact that after reading reviews on newer nikon cameras, I will probably never  buy another Nikon P&S.; (this is coming from a die hard nikon SLR user for the past 8 years)

Reviews.Title: Touch Screen Needs Improovment
Reviews.Author: SonicOrbStudios "SonicOrbStudios"
Reviews.Content: The touch screen is the only thing keeping this camera from being a full 5 star review.  I don't really want to be touching the screen or using the small pen supplied when trying to take photos.  I'd much rather have buttons and such on the body of the camera that I can easily and quickly get to.With that out of the way, the camera takes outstanding clear photos.  I just uploaded a few macro images I took the day I picked this camera up at a local store.  I can't even think where to start on the great things about this camera.Light weightCompactGreat image qualityGreat video qualityPrice is rightOutstanding macro feature

Reviews.Title: Puts The Fun Back In Photography
Reviews.Author: Nighthawk 69
Reviews.Content: OK, I just got mine so it hasn't had time to break down, but when I fired it up I was amazed at the performance! I have been a professional photographer for many years. I used the Nikon F5 for many years and then stepped up to a D700 with a battery pack. The reason I got this is because my rig (camera & all my lenses) is so heavy and cumbersome that I don't carry it around unless I'm going out on a shoot - and I end up missing many shots that I wish I had gotten. So I opted for an inexpensive point & shoot to throw in the car and take with me when I'm going to the store, running other errands or walking the dog.This little thing is just what the doctor ordered!When I fired this puppy up I was amazed! It was.... just plain fun! The focus metering blew me away and the flash was amazing. I was expecting harsh over-blown, too bright images, but what came out were very nicely lit, even exposures.Makes me wonder what the higher end point & shoot models can do. But since I have an excellent higher end Nikon, I felt that would be a waste of money. This camera does exact what I wanted it to do. It's easy to operate, the zoom is smooth, the flash works very well and the pictures look great. I highly recommend this Nikon model. The cost is so low that if it did break, or was lost or stolen, I could replace it without too much pain and suffering.

Reviews.Title: Good, touch screen needs work
Reviews.Author: Cullen
Reviews.Content: The camera takes good pictures, and the lens quality is great.  However, there are two complaints - the first being the touch screen is not that sensitive and can be annoying to use.  You have to press fairly hard to get the action to register.  Second, switching between camera modes is a bit of a pain.  I moved from an older camera that had a wheel which was easily rotated to select a shooting mode.  This camera requires a couple touch screen interactions to select a mode, which is inconvenient if you want to get a quick shot.  The answer is to always use the auto mode, however sometimes it takes a few extra seconds of recentering the view after focusing on a certain lit portion of the picture, to get an appropriate mode auto-selected.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Pocket Camera vs. Price Balance
Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: This 6100 model is an excellent and necessary upgrade from their $70-120 offerings.  The touchscreen, widescreen, too many features to list, and 720p video abilities make it a valuable tool.  The size and ease of use exceeds the competitions' cameras.  The improvement of the battery charger system (the standard wall charger eliminates the need to remove the battery to recharge) AND the PC USB connection now charges the battery as well.  After ~3 months of ownership, I haven't yet had to charge the camera off of the wall.  I do wish I bought the upgrade to this camera with the 12-14x optical zoom but even 7x is a huge improvement over the standard 2.3-3x on the $100 cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Pricerange..You wont be disappointed
Reviews.Author: John (HCPD)
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after reading through a slew of reviews at Steves Digicams, Digital Camera Review, and Cnet. I compared every camera I could find in the $150-$250 price range. I was set on not going over $250, no matter what. After being on the fence between the Sony Cybershot a Kodak touchscreen model, I decided to go with the Nikkon. Short version is this is a wonderful all around camera with very very crisp clear pictures and some nice features.Touchscreen- 8 out of 10. I will note sometimes you need to add a little more pressure than you might add on say a TomTom or other touchscreen device, but nothing too earth shatteringCamera Picture Quality - 9.5 out of 10. The pictures are crisp, reds don't seem to over saturated, and no noticeable blur towards the center or outside of a picture. I would say you are NOT going to get any better quality from a camera under $170..Picture Viewer/LCD - 9 out of 10. Clear, no huge delays between photos, sunlight friendly, and very good in terms of resolution..Video 780P - 4 out of 10. Here is where the camera looses hands down. If you are getting this camera for the added video function, LOOK ELSEWHERE! I did not need this as i have a kodak playful (i bought on amazon as always) which is small, and takes very good resolution videos. The video was grainy, and you can hear the Zoom when you use it, i personally don't care for watching a video and hearing a mechanical zoom in the background. I bought this strictly for its camera specs and quality, not the video functionOverall 8.5 out of 10.Great Camera, High Quality pictures, incredible resolution level 16MP for a camera under $200, and a nice small compact size.If your looking for cheap, easy to use, and only need it for its camera functions..I would buy it over a Sony, Olympus, Kodak, or Cannon any day of the weekAnd as always Amazon is top notch!

Reviews.Title: Don't Waste your money
Reviews.Author: Tommy B
Reviews.Content: We have tried several cameras in this price range in the last few months and this one is by far the worst.  The main problem comes when using the "auto image" function.  The camera focuses on random different things through out the room and takes a horrible blurry photo.  We tried this in several different settings and the auto function failed miserably every time.  If you have the time to scan through the scene settings every time you want to take the simplest of pictures this camera will be OK.  You will be much happier spending $100 dollars on a simple point and shoot than buy this camera.  It will take better pictures and you will at least pay for what you get.  Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: Worst camera I've owned
Reviews.Author: Viktor
Reviews.Content: - terrible egronomics and handling, no way to shot with one hand, end up accidently pressing buttons or screen.- Slow, terrible autofocus, slow thinking camera, 50% of photos are out of focus or missed moments.- low light photogprahy is non-existant, noise is unbearable!- freezes up, so you have to turn it off and on again- locks picture files on SD card when connected directly to computer with USB, so you have to copy them to a folder on harddrive to editAvoid!!!

Reviews.Title: Nikon s6100
Reviews.Author: Michael D. Henke "Michael H"
Reviews.Content: Takes nice pictures but the long wait between snapping shots is unacceptable.  Camera turns on by itself when stored in a case in my backpack, battery is always dead for this reason so rather frustrating.  I had a four year old panasonic lumix that finally broke after a drop, wish i would have bought another one rather than the Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Great performance in a small package.
Reviews.Author: Nasenebenhoule
Reviews.Content: I must differ with the few negative reviews for this camera.I have a Coolpix S550 that is several years old, has features that are not as flexible as the S6100, but takes fine photos.  The S6100 takes the S550 performance ahead a few levels.  There are settings which allow the photographer to apply many selectable options or, set the camera to AUTO and let the software do the work.  Work that it does very well.  I am a veteran of 30 years of film cameras (two Nikon bodies, seven lenses and ten plus filters) who finds that this small camera does everything all of my film equipment could do, plus a lot more.  Add to that what I can do with each photo once loaded into my MacBook Pro and the possibilities are endless.  I must conclude that the authors of the negative reviews are not experienced photographers.  Anyone with a background in full manual film cameras would have zero difficulty with the S6100.  Thanks Nikon!!!

Reviews.Title: Terrible Camera
Reviews.Author: Teton
Reviews.Content: This camera disappoints on every level.  I've never written a review for anything, but I felt compelled to make sure as few people as possible waste their money on this camera.  It fails to focus. It fails to take pictures when I'm ready to shoot, even after 3 presses of the button, resulting in "moment over" disappointing images.  The touch screen picture viewing is not user friendly and does not work consistently.  I've never been more displeased with a retail purchase in my entire life.

Reviews.Title: Best Pics Ever....
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: Nothing bad about this product.  We had a kodak camera before and we could not get a clear Pic if our life depended on it.  Now no problems at all.  Easy to use, love the touch screen.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: AmazonGirl1983
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in this camera.  I want to stress that I am a big fan of Nikon; my digital SLR and all the accessories are Nikon.  So when my Casio Exilm broke (after working wonderfully for 4 years and then being dropped), I thought the Coolpix would be an upgrade.  The Coolpix worked wonderfully on our vacation, but the pictures were mostly outside in the daylight.  But I found that when taking pictures indoors, they either came out clear, but with a strong yellow color cast, or normal coloring but fuzzy focus.  I know in many of the situations, the problem could have been easily fixed with a flash, but the camera wouldn't allow it to be turned on.  This was true as I switched between scene and auto modes.  All of that aside, the placement of the buttons on the back side is very unfortunate.  It is way too easy to accidentally press the buttons (causing scene mode changes or switching to video mode when it is not needed).  I did this almost every time I tried to take a portrait oriented photo.  Long story short: I don't like the touch screen.  I don't like the lack of manual controls.Back to the Casio Exilm I go.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: buggys mommy
Reviews.Content: I have had two Slr cameras, one 35mm and one digital. (both pentax) I wanted to be able to have some of my SLR qualities in a point and shoot and so far this has been great! I have had this since it came out. This has been my first point and shoot.All of the pre set scene selections are amazing! I was taken back by the quality of the fireworks mode!The touch screen is eh so-so. It isnt as good as an ipod touch or ipad. Although much better lg phones, and droids touch response. only real quirky thing is the firmness, you need to use the side of your nail or stylis instead of fingertip.I am very pleased that this did not have the "lag" that the other point and shoots I had played with (of friends and family) had. (pentax, kodak, cannon.) It does great with action shots esp. keeping up with a 4yr old and dog. I was even able to capture faces of kids on a merry-go-round!!!

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera - far beyond it's size
Reviews.Author: Charlie in Austin
Reviews.Content: For years I used a pro-grade Nikon film camera, so my standards are high.  For international travel and family events, the Nikon S series pocket cameras achieve results as good as the old pro camera.  (I haven't tried giant poster prints, but that isn't my goal).  My friends with heavy cameras can't believe I get travel pictures with the Nikon S series that compare with their "bulky" digital cameras.  When our old S610 started acting funny, we bought the new S6100 as the primary replacement, and will carry the old 610 as our "backup" second camera.  The anti-vibration features allow shots that would previously have required a tripod.  I have gotten low-light pictures that friends with expensive cameras could not capture. The lens sharpness is pure Nikon.  The Nikon S series are GREAT.

Reviews.Title: So bad I had to exchange for a Canon
Reviews.Author: Marie
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews, I thought this would be the best option.  I needed to upgrade from my older Sony Cyber Shot and wanted a better zoom, better quality pictures, better camera for low light, and one that was easy to use.The Nikon S6100 was worse than my old Sony model, so much so that I had to return it.  The touch screen was extremely frustrating.  Very poor design and very slow.  Also, if you want a camera you can pick up and use quickly, do not purchase this camera.  I spent hours reading the manual (which has to be download to your computer)and still could not figure out some of the features.  I took a few pictures, had then developed and the quality was very poor.Thought I would write this review to save someone the frustration.  I return it and purchased a Canon SX230, which cost more but after using it a few days, it is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: Expected more from Nikon
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: I am a photographer. I've used many DSLR cameras and still use one on a regular basis.I wanted a small, quick point-and-shoot camera to use for fun purposes, like parties, road trips, etc. Something that I could shove in my pocket and take a quick snapshot.Having used a Nikon DSLR for years, I came to expect a lot from the brand. But after playing with this camera, I'm pretty disappointed. The biggest problem I have with it is the touch screen. It is a pressure-sensitive screen, unlike a smartphone or an iPad. You can't gently slide your finger around or tap on icons. You really have to PUSH on the icons to make menus work, and you have to really press and drag to look at your photos. Not only that, if you aren't familiar with a certain icon in the menu, there is no way to read the title without actually pressing it and using that setting. So the only way to find out what these mean (short of memorizing the manual) is trial and error. The camera does come with a stylus that works fairly well, but if you're anything like me, you aren't going to want to have to make sure you have the stylus with you all the time and you wont want to take the time to find the stylus and use it every time you want to use the camera. The whole point (for me) was to have a quick camera. I don't need to waste time playing with a stylus.Another problem I have with this particular camera is the fact that despite "image stabilization" you get blurry photos in adequate lighting situations. I turned the flash off because I was in a well-lit room, and the photo still came out blurry. If I were able to adjust the shutter speed, maybe this wouldn't be a big deal. But as far as I can tell, I can't. Even if I could, the menus are so frustrating that I gave up. There are very few words in the menus. They are made of not-so-standard symbols that are less than descriptive.Overall, I found that I loved the IDEA of this camera, and am ultimately disappointed with the actual product.

Reviews.Title: Techno-easy, great pictures.
Reviews.Author: sunshine
Reviews.Content: As a 67 y/o grandmother with a photography hobby of creating many items for charity fundraising, I find my new Nikon to: be compact and light-weight enough for my purse yet solid enough for a good grasp, have an excellent LCD view, an easy to operate touch-screen for the casual photographer yet plenty of features to satisfy the more advanced enthusiast. Minor drawbacks are the on/off button which requires a firm pressure to activate and the carry-case is too small to hold an extra battery. But, the simple plug-in to recharge the battery, the increased zoom and wide-angle lens are great new additions (for me) that make it worth the trade-off.

Reviews.Title: nikon S 6100
Reviews.Author: Doolittle
Reviews.Content: If you had the nikon S4000 . You will love this camera ! Takes great pictures , great detailCan be seen . All in all great camera ! Slim , sleek , light weight .  Great for on the go actionEasy to understand/.

Reviews.Title: Good camera ...  But lots of technical problem !!
Reviews.Author: thegeek
Reviews.Content: I purchased it and using it for 1 month !It takes good pics and overall good point & shoot compact digital camera.Image quality is good. overall good model, but touch screen menu is not so good thing, for camera traditional button menu are far better than touch screen in my opinion.And we cannt compare this touch screen with iphone, ipad or any other android base phone for that matter. This touch screen is lot much sloggy than iphone !!touch screen is most irritating thing to change image options.Also, whenever we have to choose scene modes it does not give any idea on scene mode selection mode ! that is time consuming thing.I would like to add some technical problem which I encountered for this camera is that after one month it started giving me technical trouble for charging because of that I sent camera 2 times to Nikon care center. Thanks god its in warranty period but still I spend 40 bucks more in shipping twice to nikon center (for 200 bucks product) and on top of that more trouble.I would not recommend to buy from this seller. !!

Reviews.Title: Nikon s6100
Reviews.Author: Parrotone
Reviews.Content: It is a nice little camera, great photos for casual shots and fun shots.Color is good, backlight setting could use a little more umph.

Reviews.Title: Awful, hideous, terrible...
Reviews.Author: milojah
Reviews.Content: The interface is horrible.The quality is terrible.It stopped charging after 4 months, and after spending 2 weeks with Nikon (mailed at my expense) it came back, now it charges, but it doesn't take pictures. It's behaving like it's set to ISO .00001, and I'm not sure it's worth another $20 to ship it back.No more Nikons, long live Panasonic Lumix.

Reviews.Title: Awful Camera
Reviews.Author: San Jose
Reviews.Content: This camera only worked for a month before it malfunctioned.  When you turn it on the lens won't open.  I sent it in for repair and it was returned to me in almost the same state.  It worked for two pictures before it broke again.  I will never buy another Nikon product!

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA, EASY TO USE
Reviews.Author: Txscootr98
Reviews.Content: DID SOME RESEARCH BEFORE I BOUGHT THIS, IT'S LESS EXPENSIVE BUYING IT ON HERE THEN THE BIG BOX STORES, THE TOUCH SCREEN IS EASY TO USE, I HAVE NO ISSUES.DESPITE WHAT SOME OF THE REVIEWS SAY, THIS IS A GREAT PRODUCT, DONT LET THE TOUCH SCREEN SCARE YOU AWAY.I ALSO BOUGHT AN EXTRA BATERY AND CHANGER, FROM A DIFFERENT SELLER, WOW BOTH ITEMS ARRIVED THE SAME DAY, I HAD THE BATTERY CHARGED IN NO TIME FLAT, FROM THE START THIS CAMERA IS SIMPLE TO USE.I WOULD BUY THIS AGAIN, YOU NEED THISTHANKS

Reviews.Title: Review of Nikon Cool Pix 6100
Reviews.Author: Roy Rhino
Reviews.Content: We have been using the camera for a few weeks now and we are not camera bugs.  We just wanted a reliable camera that is easy to use and takes good quality photos.  This one is it. It is easy to use right out of the box and the video was simple, but you have to watch which way you put the camera or you will be tilting your head.  The video is vertical, not horizontal. We love it. We sent back an Olympus of the same type. It was awful. Get a Nikon!

Reviews.Title: fabulous!!!
Reviews.Author: hhpnw
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic camera.  Super easy to use.  Takes pictures quicly enough to capture my toddlers smile and wacky ways, which for me sets it apart from my last camera.  The photo quality is the best I have ever had.  It is small enough to fit in a pocket.  I like the vidoe feature as well.  I looked at a bunch of other cameras.  I have had this one for 2 months now and I could not be happier with my choice.  This is a wonderful high quality camera.

Reviews.Title: Love This Camera
Reviews.Author: harthous
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera just before going to Disney World and to Alaska this summer.  The pictures I took at both locations are fabulous.  If there were one thing I could change about the camera it would be that the zoom was 10X instead of 7X.  But that would have been more money.  The editing features right on the camera are great and when I download my pictures, they are basically ready to print.  So, for the price I paid - I am very happy with my camera and I highly recommend it for anyone looking for an inexpensive, easy to use pocket camera.

Reviews.Title: Love....but breaks
Reviews.Author: Frustrated
Reviews.Content: I really love this camera, I can shoot great pictures, but the problem is, it keeps breaking. I got. This camera before I went to camp and a month later it broke. It wouldn't charge. I couldn't turn it on so I thought it was dead. I charged it and it still wouldn't turn on. I went to radioshack and they said it was the camera. So, gladly I had the warranty paper, and could send it in. I got it back and it worked great! I was so happy. Now, about a month or a little longer later, it has happened again! It won't charge (green light isn't flashing) and last night it had more than half it's battery. I'm really sad because I think this is an amazingly good camera, I am very happy with a lot of the pictures I have taken, I wish it would work. So, this is a warning, I am not sure if it is just my specific camera or nikon's coolpix in general.  The camera is a touch screen and with that comes a lot of editing options, like drawing on your picture. You can rotate, make it black and white, color specify, glamorize, etc. It is so cool! Many people have told me the lighting is really good as well. I am pleased with this camera, just REALLY sad.

Reviews.Title: WORST BATTERY DESIGN/CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: pork eating crusader
Reviews.Content: In 30+ years of using ALL types of cameras this is the WORST experience with ANY camera and  camera company. Just "Google" Nikon 6100 and will see I am not alone in this opinion. Basicly, the so-called Nikon engineers designed and put into production a piece of crap! The battery drains so far down, it can't take a charge. Something in the camera was so poorly engineered that it does not entirely turn off. I took it back to the retailer and they sent it to Nikon. They (Nikon) sent it back with a letter that basicly said "the battery was drained too far down to take a charge" What crap!!! It sat in box off fully charged for ONLY TWO weeks....When we went to use it, it was so dead it would not take a charge. Anyway, they did send it back with a charged battery and they also had ME pay the $13 shipping fee....When I called Nikon (the liars) said they would contact me via e-mail or phone- they never did and it has been over 2 weeks. Also, the so-called customer service person said the have NEVER heard of any problem with the Coolprix 6100-ever.....LIES LIES LIES. I told her she should Google it....So now I have to check it and charge it about ever week. Nikon needs to admit they have a problem here. Just check all the negitive reviews on Google and even Amazon. I will NEVER BUY NIKON AGAIN! It is a matter of principle. And no one should have to check a battery on a point and shoot weekly....I should have bought a Canon. Avoid this Nikon unless you need a $$ paper weight?

Reviews.Title: Good for Five Months
Reviews.Author: JP
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in January and it took fantastic pictures in 16:9 format. Fantastic camera for five months. A few days ago it shut off abruptly even though the battery seemed fully charged. The camera was a bit warm. I couldn't charge it either on my computer or with the wall charger.I ordered a replacement charger and new batteries. The new battery took about ten pictures. Then I kept getting a "battery temperature high." I left the camera alone for a few hours. Over the past few days I've gotten several different messages--battery temperature high, battery exhausted. At times it would turn on, indicate that the battery was fully charged a let me take 1-2 pictures then completely shut off with the same battery exhausted message. No matter how long I charge the battery and how fully charged it is, it keeps giving the same message.Other times I just get a white screen.This is a great camera if you want one that will only function for several months. Before this I had a Casio Exilim 12 MP. It worked great for the longest time.You'll love the Nikon Coolpix...until it craps out on you. Spend slightly over $100 for a disposable camera. That's about all the Nikon Coolpix S6100 is. Waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Very unimpressive for shots with movement
Reviews.Author: Twisty
Reviews.Content: My family bought this camera for me as a gift prior to our family vacation based upon the rave reviews. I loved the display, ease of use, and compact size, but I am not impressed with its performance. The camera takes fairly decent photos if your subjects are in good lighting and are perfectly still, but if there is movement of any kind, the pictures often come out with ghost-like blurring. I tried using the action setting to see if that would help with the blurring, but it did not appear to make any difference. Many of our vacation pictures came out blurred, and I missed a lot of photo opportunities because I could not get the camera to focus in time to get the shot IF it focused at all.While waiting for our flight in an airport terminal, our sons were sitting on the floor a short distance across from us as they charged their laptop with a wall outlet that they had found. I tried to capture the moment, but no matter how many pictures I took, I could not get the camera to focus even though I tried different settings, flash vs no flash, and distances with the zoom. I don't know if it was because of the lighting in the terminal or the reflection of the shiny polished floor that they were sitting on that was causing the issue. I had the same problem at a family member's home one morning during breakfast. Most of the family was standing around talking, while other family members moved about. Once again, almost all the photos blurred. I'm pretty certain that the camera was having a hard time focusing because of the lighting in that instance. Another time our kids and their cousins were playing in a family member's front yard. The time of day was perfect; it was early evening with lots of natural indirect light. But every single photo blurred except the ones that I took of people that were standing perfectly still. Some of the photos came out with one person focused, while another right next to them looked ghost-like because they were in motion. For someone like me who likes to catch natural photos of people and life in action, I would not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: VERY UPSET
Reviews.Author: MegMarie
Reviews.Content: The only reason it has 2 stars is because it used to work! This camera is less then 4 months old and Im already having a malfunction with the lens!!! I have a very important even tonight and this camera was needed! Very let down by this product that wasn't CHEAP!!! GO ELSEWHERE!!!!! Hopefully I can still return it!

Reviews.Title: Great, then not so great...
Reviews.Author: WanderingMermaid
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at a blow out sale. Worth the $80! I've had some great times with it and have snapped some amazing shots. However, the lens started making funny noises and is now broken. I can no longer use my camera. It lasted a little less than 2 years even though I took excellent care of it. Bummed. I think I'll try something else this time around.

Reviews.Title: One Year Was All It Took
Reviews.Author: Cynthia A. Spicher
Reviews.Content: Some products last and last but this camera would no longer work after only one year and it was too late for the warranty.  I barely used it and am greatly disappointed that it quit working in such a short time especially since I paid about $130.  I will not likely buy a Nikon again.  I have a much older Cannon camera which I have dropped a few times etc and it still works after years of travel and picture taking.  Should have went with a brand I already trusted.

Reviews.Title: Does not take pictures quick enough
Reviews.Author: amamzon0221
Reviews.Content: This camera was OK when first purchased, but to take a picture of a moving toddler, forget it. Pictures inside are also not of the best quality. In less than a year the rechargeable battery no longer fully charges. A disappointing purchase.

Reviews.Title: B to the S
Reviews.Author: amazon user
Reviews.Content: So I bought this camera thinking it was an upgrade from my Sony cybershot, but I was quickly proven wrong.  THIS CAMERA FRICKEN SUCKS! The touchscreen stopped working in 5 uses! The pictures take forever to snap and are blurry unless you have a steady hand.  Take your money and buy a sony camera.  I learned my lesson :(

Reviews.Title: Use Camara Right Away
Reviews.Author: Ruined Christmas
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera while vacationing in South Carolina and since I had an old camera I did not use my new one until Christmas this year or I thought I would.I charged the battery back in February when I bought it and then thought I would use it for Christmas.  The camera was dead so no problem we got the charger out and low and behold nothing, nada.  We tried it in the socket and on our computer and still nothing.My son who is a computer whiz was stumped so we figure it needs repairing which seems odd since we had never used it.Now I am in Canada without a warranty and without a camera unless I either pay for a new battery or who knows what it wrong with it.  Did anyone else experience this problem?

Reviews.Title: Broke within 6 months
Reviews.Author: Yo mama
Reviews.Content: Stopped woking for no reason.  Spent money on another battery.  Still not working.  Normally I like Nikon, but this turned out to be useless.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Warranty Fails to Cover Battery
Reviews.Author: John M Chapman
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera last year around Black Friday for a friend. She wanted a nice camera to learn how to start taking digital photos. At first the camera was nice, the photos it took looked good and it worked well, especially for beginner. That changed when she tried to use it around October this year. She had used it a few times, for Christmas, New Years, and a few birthdays, but when she attempted to use it last month (October 2012) the camera wouldn't power on and the battery wouldn't charge. After obtaining a second battery (one from a friend's same model camera) I verified that the battery must be the problem as the friend's battery powered on the camera and charged.I decided to call Nikon as naturally the camera was still under warranty and I was unaware that the battery was excluded from the warranty. Upon calling them I was instructed to send the camera in alone (and pay for shipping out of pocket), without the battery or any accessories (they failed to inform me then that the battery was not included in the warranty). After receiving the camera back, which I was informed was fully functioning (as I already knew), the included paper stated that I should have sent in the battery and charger. The camera, when returned, was badly packaged, the box was damaged and the touch panel covering the screen now has a bubble in it. Upon calling back I was told that the person I had previously spoke to was mis-informed and that I should have sent in the battery and charger along with the camera. Upon asking if I could receive a replacement for what is obviously a bad battery, the representative finally informed me that the battery is not considered an "accessory" with the camera and thus it is excluded from the warranty.This exclusion from the warranty makes little sense and I have filed a complaint with Nikon because of it. After speaking with other Nikon point-and-shoot owners, it seems that bad batteries are a fairly common problem and that the batteries should not be trusted to last. Thus, since the original battery failed (and others have experienced the same) it makes little sense to purchase another Nikon branded battery.Overall the camera was a nice one while it was functional, the lack of adequate support on Nikon's part is really horrible and the reason why I gave this camera only one out of five. Be aware, however, that the battery exclusion for the warranty is true for all Nikon cameras (at least that is what I was told by the representative).

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Ltejeda84
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me this camera for Christmas by the end of February the camera wouldn't charge. I later looked it up and it seems to be a common problem. This was bought as a replacement for a Sony camera that was dropped and broken, which had lasted me three years with not a problem. Too bad it was a gift.

Reviews.Title: Shutter broke after a few months
Reviews.Author: Kendi
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this camera.  And, for the first few months that I had it, I did.  It is a great point and shoot camera.  I like the pictures and video it takes....especially the different scene settings and smart picture option.  Then all of a sudden after only having the camera a few months (like 5 months) the shutter cover jammed and is broken.  Sad.  Hopefully I just got a lemon b/c I really loved it while it worked.

Reviews.Title: Poor build quality, poor customer service
Reviews.Author: J. Wexler "Sepharad"
Reviews.Content: Bought it, used it. takes good pictures in bright light. poor detection in low light with autofocus producing poor results. Automatic lens cover is junk. Began sticking. Nikon refused to repair under warranty 10 days after warranty expired. Camera actually ceased functioning while still under warranty. I owned a D40 previously and was preparing to buy a D3100. I will now buy Canon instead. Basically they built a crappy quality camera and don't stand behind it. Result is they have forever lost me as a customer and an $700 sale. I highly advise against any camera with an "automatic" lens cover.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your time
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before, but had to let others know about this product.  All the 4 and 5 star reviews I have read must have written the reviews at time they received this camera.  I have had this camera for 7 months and it is terrible, it takes yellow tinted pictures or blurry pictures, forget taking any pictures in the evening it won't even show up.  The battery is always dead no matter how long you charge it.  The only good thing I can say is that the video works pretty good, but I didn't buy it for a video camera I wanted something to take pictures with.  Had to purchase a new camera.Nikon COOLPIX S6100 16 MP Digital Camera with 7x NIKKOR Wide-Angle Optical Zoom Lens and 3-Inch Touch-Panel LCD (Silver)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Poor Service
Reviews.Author: kristen12345
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera in the beginning of March and used it on my trip to San Francisco. I LOVED it. It took great quality pictures and I got a lot of compliments on the pictures. However, then my disappointment started. My camera recently broke (the lens stopped opening and closing) I contacted Amazon and they told me there is nothing they can do, it is past my time allowed for returns. While I understand that there needs to be return periods in place, it is not like I changed my mind on the camera- the product they sold me broke, after 4 months. I have a feeling that a digital camera should not have a 4 month quality.My advice, buy it from Best Buy where they help you fix it and have guarantees on their product.I just checked best buy - it is only $10 more there. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this garbage!
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline Elias "daniela elias"
Reviews.Content: I buy this camera 11 months ago don't hold battery charging this camera is a piece of junk we lost to take pictures and recorder my kids in the school now I have the last days of the school again and not working anymore! Don't spend money in this camera arruined my life! I don't have memories of the last school days of my kids and now not working anymore!

Reviews.Title: Impossible to get your pictures off this camera/Consumes Batteries
Reviews.Author: C. Salyer "Cliff Salyer"
Reviews.Content: I've had the camera for about a year now and hardly ever use it because it's such a huge pain to get the pictures off of the camera.  It's the only thing I ever plugged into my Mac that my Mac does not recognize. Loaded the CD onto my PC and it still just doesn't want to work.  I hate this camera because of the problems I face every time I try to use it. I would not buy this camera.Not to beat a dead horse but this is the worst camera ever for eating batteries. I've barely even had a chance to use it and already I'm on my 3rd battery. After the original went dead and would not recharge, I installed the 2nd battery and resolved to leave the camera perpetually plugged into my computer.  Unfortunately, my USB hub shorted out and for 1 week was not working. In that short time the battery completely discharged and will not charge now. Once the battery is dead it cannot be recharged. Now going for the 3rd battery I have to decide is it even worth it? Time to throw the entire thing in the trash since it never works when I need it to.  First and last Nikon purchase. Never again.DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA OR ANY OTHER COOLPIX. TWO THUMBS DOWN!!

Reviews.Title: 2 broke already with lens errors, 1 still standing
Reviews.Author: Phillip F. Collett, Jr. "Nope"
Reviews.Content: So I have bought a total of 3 of these now, and might buy a 4th because I have extra batteries. 1 was already returned within 2 weeks because of a lens errror. The lens is fully extended and will not retract and turning the camera off on worked a few times then nothing.I sent the broken one back and got a replacement. The second camera (I bought 2 initially and extra batteries and a battery charger station) was seldom used, maybe 6 times until last week, just started doing the same thing but on and off does not work. I am not going to force it shut since I am still well within mfg warranty.Going to see which other models work with the batteries I have and maybe break down and give this model a 4th chance.

Reviews.Title: It's an okay camera
Reviews.Author: Mommy2010
Reviews.Content: Before I purchased this camera in red I owned a Nikon S6000 and I was hoping this would be similar with a few upgrades, but I have been disappointed. The camera looks cool, is easy to care, and has a touch screen, but the picture quality is not near as good on this camera as it is on the S6000. Also, the touch screen has been a pain for us. Sommetimes is works just like it should, other times it's really sensitive, and most of the time it's hard to get to work.The camera is a simple point and click, but unless you must have a touch screen version I would highly suggest the Nikon S6000. It takes very clear quality photos everytime ypu pick it up.

Reviews.Title: not so good.  frustrating camera
Reviews.Author: baa hollow
Reviews.Content: I was happy with this at first but after a year of steady use i really am unhappy.  Its slow between shots, low lighting is not good. lens error is showing up all the time now and some times it just won't work.  always need my second battery close by as well.  don't buy it

Reviews.Title: Not so easy-to-use and produces blurry photos
Reviews.Author: Analei
Reviews.Content: I received this as a gift 4 months ago and like others, really want to like it but instead it just frustrates me. Most of my pictures are blurry and it upsets me that I cannot get decent photos at celebrations that are often at night and in artificial lighting. I am definitely not a fan of the touchscreen functions as I often end up taking pictures when I don't mean to. I want the shutter button to be the only method of picture taking and don't know why anyone would need the touch screen function for that. Moreover, what happens if the screen scratches? There is no back up way to go through your settings since there are no buttons on the side to do so (which I prefer over the touchscreen buttons anyway because they are very finicky). I will admit that I am definitely an amateur at photography, so maybe I am just not knowledgeable enough to know what settings to change in order to get better quality photos, but I was under the impression this was supposed to be an easy-to-use camera, and it is not. Prior to this I had a Sony Cybershot DSC-W290 and I LOVED it. The only reason I was given this Nikon camera was because my old camera was stolen. I think I am going to give away or sell this one and buy the camera that I know is actually easy to use and always produced good photos for me.

Reviews.Title: Durability is Questionable
Reviews.Author: FunK
Reviews.Content: It's a good camera and offers features my other older model nikons don't, but after 3 days of owning it, it started to malfunction. The upper shutter got stuck and lodged itself into an awkward position, obscuring the view. I had to use brute force to pry it out and then it completely came out of the camera. Luckily I was able to attach the shutter back in and now it works fine again. I own many cameras, especially Nikons, and this has never happened to me before. Other than the shutter, the quality is exceptionally and the resolution of the photos are great when imported into a computer or printed.

Reviews.Title: nikon cool pic s6100
Reviews.Author: kc
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I loved the touch screen features.  I received it quickly and found it very easy to use.  My frustration started about 1 month after receiving.  The camera would not take a charge anymore.  I emailed Nikon customer support twice for assistance and they never even responded however right after I emailed them I started receiving Nikon advertising emails!It was suggested by a friend that I try a new camera battery even though the camera was a month old I thought I would give that a try.  After searching for a new Nikon replaement battery I found they were around $40.00!  I found an inexpensive one on Amazon.com for around $10.00 and that seemed to fix that problem.So the camera worked for a couple of weeks just fine THEN I turned it on & noticed the screen black on each side of the viewfinder.  The shutter won't open up all the way.  I could take my finger & slide the bottom open but the top shutter cover wont open. I finally got it open & now it won't shut!I gave up on emailing Nikon so I called their support number and they said I could send it in for repair & it was covered under warrenty.  I sent it back today via UPS and that cost me $10.00.  They said repair should take appx 2 weeks so we'll see.........So to recap - yeah the camera is great when it works

Reviews.Title: Nikon Lover
Reviews.Author: Liz - Austin TX
Reviews.Content: I am already a Nikon fan so no selling needed.  Love the camera!  Only drawback is the wait til the camera locates focal point to focus.  The seller along with Amazon made the purchase quick and easy.  Even arrived a little ahead of time!

Reviews.Title: Good camera -- as long as you read the CD manual (4- stars)
Reviews.Author: Debbie Lee Wesselmann
Reviews.Content: Although it looks like a typical point-and-shoot camera, the Coolpix S6100 requires a little more finesse than some to operate at its best.  Sure, it can do automatic point-and-shoot photos, but unless you understand the two-step focusing process, the multiple focusing windows that appear, how to fix the disappearing screen, how the touchscreen works, etc., you may struggle.  The quick start manual that comes with the camera provides little help.  Once I figured out most of the features, however, I came to really like this camera.First, the good:  it takes excellent 16 MP photos, with a 7x optical zoom.  The lens quality is above many competitors'.  You can focus on a specific object or person, or take a quick photo, just by tapping the screen.  The large LCD screen is easy to see, even in fairly bright light, and the on-screen menu displays are readily visible when activated.  I like that I can take a picture with a touch of the screen rather than depressing the shutter button, although I have taken a few accidental pictures this way when handling the camera.  (This feature can be turned off.)  Switching between still pictures and video is easier than on most cameras since there is a specialized button right next to the screen.  Battery life is about average for a Li-On; my husband goes through two sets of AA batteries for his Sony in the number of shots I can take, with more on-time, on the S6100.  If you point the camera into the sun, a red circle appears in the viewfinder to alert you to a potential exposure problem.Next, the bad:  the time to write to the memory card is too slow, even when you select Continuous mode.  The touch screen, while generally responsive, sometimes lacks sensitivity, especially when using the lower tab.  The included stylus, which you can attach to the strap, works much better than a finger.  Autofocus doesn't work if you are using the zoom and have disabled the flash.Last, the neutral:  the included CD that contains PDF versions of the manual in several languages provides ample detail on how to use the camera and its advanced features.  The camera maintains the last settings used from power-on to power-on.  Although the factory settings direct the camera to sleep after 30 seconds of non-use (a real pain, especially if you're sight-seeing!), you can change the length of time to sleep (I use 30 minutes).  Make sure you buy an SDHC memory card since the camera does not come with even a low-capacity card.  It's a little on the bulky side compared to most of today's point-and-shoot compact digital cameras, an inch thick at its widest, but it's still much thinner than my old Canon Stylus.I like this camera despite some of its shortcomings.  On a recent trip, 95 percent of my photos were sharp, with good color reproduction.  The rest were either accidental shots, failed attempts to shoot a moving object, or, in a very few cases, unfocused shots.  That's as good as any digital camera I've owned.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann

Reviews.Title: Nikon CoolPix
Reviews.Author: Mary E Ellis
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter-in-law for Christmas. It came fully charged so she could use it right out of the box. The picture quality is fantastic. My daughter-in-law used it while visiting her family out of state and she said it is the best camera she has ever owned. Even better than her old SLR camera that she still loves.

Reviews.Title: Very Functional
Reviews.Author: avidshopper
Reviews.Content: We got this camera just in time for Christmas. It took a little practice to learn the device. There are a lot of features, some of which work well together and some don't. The bettery life is great, it didn't say to charge it right away so I didn't (i may have missed it in the user guide), it didn't last very long at first, but after the first full charge it has been going for a while, flash and all.The pictures will show up in poor quality on the LCD quick view but when you go play them back they will look better. The LCD still does not do them compared to how they will look on your PC. The flash will produce a yellow background on the camera, but on the PC it looks much better.You have to experiment a bit. This really is a great camera, just don't get frustrated the first day or two until you read the instructions. The quick guide included may not be enough, don't hesitate to pull the CD which has the full unser's manual if you're not getting the hang of it.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: J C
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace one that the humidity in my tropical home destroyed.  I dreaded having to learn the quirks of a new camera, but I've found this one to be simple to use.  And it takes good photos too.  :-)  I've now used it in and out of doors and in low and high light situations and been pleased with the results every time.

Reviews.Title: Nice ,new shiny camera
Reviews.Author: MARGARET
Reviews.Content: I like this camera and it is supposed to take all kinds of great pictures.  I wish that they had included a how to manual and that I hadn't had to print one.  I have printed 94 pages so far, but I have not printed everything yet.  A manual would really have been nice.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Perla Margarita Unzueta
Reviews.Content: nice and excellente price, good color, light, I love my camara. picture are excellente, addition is touch. my english is not good, I can not writte any more.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Daniboy
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera, and takes very good pictures.The only downsides I could find are the touch screen and that you can not practically do any manual correction to the settings.Overall this is an excellent product for the price.

Reviews.Title: she can use it
Reviews.Author: James Ricketts "Cricketts"
Reviews.Content: Finally! A pocket camera that is so intuitive that my wife can use it without the frustration of "How do I do that??:

Reviews.Title: How Can anyone not like this camera?
Reviews.Author: Melanie La Pan
Reviews.Content: I had been looking forf a basic under $200 camera. I tried out a few others including a Kodak. All were very dissapointing. The main problem is that most lower priced point and shoots take crappy pictures. This Nikon takes wonderful ones! I found the Auto and the smart modes so easy to use. I almost never get a bad picture. I love the battery life and the 3 inches screen. Close ups are beautiful and detailed! I do a lot ebay selling and this sure comes in handy.  The touch screen is a bit tricky, but not so bad. I think it is a matter of getting use to this feature. The zoom is adequate and the quality of the video is good.  I honestly do not see why anyone would have a problem with this camera. I guess if you are a pro you may not find it adequate. For the price it is a heck of a camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent point & shoot camera
Reviews.Author: RascalOreo
Reviews.Content: This is a very good product.  This camera replaced my old S3100, and I am very pleased with it.  Has some nice bells & whistles, and is very easy to operate.  Picture quality is quite good.

Reviews.Title: greatest little camera
Reviews.Author: P-22 "M. D."
Reviews.Content: my huband bought this camera for me as a birthday gift, i have used the camera everyday since i got it. its small so i can take it anywhere, its cute and the pictures are beautiful. the camera is so simple to use, you dont even need the directions. did i happen to mention the pictures are absolutely beautiful, no red eye, no blurs, and its a video camera too. i'd recomend this camera a hundred times over, i love it!

Reviews.Title: Picture Perfect*
Reviews.Author: Angela
Reviews.Content: Wow, this is really a great camera. Slim,wonderful pictures. I have not checked all the features yet, I know I am going to love all that Nikon has to offer. I would recommend this to all that likes to take pictures.

Reviews.Title: try it, you'll like it
Reviews.Author: rdbrg1
Reviews.Content: I'm not into photo's per say. It takes great pics. Has a lot of options that I need to figure out.I like the battery, how you just plug it in and charge it. I was worried about that before I bought it. I also bought a 16gig card. I have plenty of space. The price was right.

Reviews.Title: fantastic
Reviews.Author: Rick Sargent
Reviews.Content: The price was he best I found. The product was a day earlier than the expected day. The camera takes excellent pictures.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product! Worth Buying!
Reviews.Author: Mohan
Reviews.Content: Excellent Product! Worth Buying!. Camera boots very quickly. Camera is fast enough for multiple pictures. Accurate Auto-focus. Good Image stabilization. Good Zoom Quality. Great quality in low lights. Handy and Easy to use. Lovely touch screen

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Janice Hedstrom
Reviews.Content: So far this is a great camera.  I really haven't had the time to fully explore all the features.  I am taking it on vacation and will put it to the real test then.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Teo
Reviews.Content: This camera takes amazing photos, especially in the close-up mode. There are many different settings for different scenes that are great too. The zoom is awesome too.

Reviews.Title: Best camera ever!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Edina
Reviews.Content: I have seen many cameras, and this is by far the best one ever. Normally Nikon cameras aren't that good because they don't have glass lenses, they have plastic ones. The bigger Nikons are not that good. This one takes good pics, they are clear and have a great resolution. I like this one the best. I think this one is the best buy that you could ever get, I mean for the money, it is the best ever. I just love this little gadget!!!!! Word of advice- GET THIS!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Jayme Terrigno
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this little camera. Its lightweight, easy to use, excellent battery life and the touch screen is nice. Oh, and the picture quality is fab!!I get that some people aren't use to the touch screen... And neither was I, so it took a few uses to really be able to quickly  get through camera functions... But once you play with it, its good. I was always a cannon girl and loved my little cameras, but I really wanted something new. I was concerned because I love the photo quality of my cannons, but this camera takes an AWESOME photo!!! I have used it at a baseball game, a bachelorette party and a wedding in the last couple weeks... And the pictures are perfect. The video quality is awesome too! Just one thing on that... Keep recording even if your countdown restarts... It makes it one video when you upload it, but could be confusing if you don't figure it out quick.The on camera editing is cool, not really my thing... But its cute!

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Johnathan Trent Guerra
Reviews.Content: Best camera I have ever owned! I will recommend this camera to all my friends and family! This camera is very portable and captures clear, colorful pictures. Love it!

Reviews.Title: TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE W THIS COMPANY-NEVER SUPPORTING THEM AGAIN
Reviews.Author: Marie
Reviews.Content: I bought my COOL PIX camera after researching and reading great reviews for my business back in October 2011. It is now March 2012, and I've had it in my possession for a total of about 2-3 months. The rest of that time, it has been in repairs. I sent it back post Christmas after the lens jammed open. I was instructed to send the camera minus all accessories and battery. When I got it back from them, not only would it not work at all, it had a brand new scratch down the face, about 1/4-1/3 the size. I called the company,explained all this, and requested either a totally new unit, or a full refund; and was told by the supervisor to send it in and be advised of the "next step." Now, the reasonable person in me understands it could just be a faulty unit in an otherwise stellar line, however the costumer in me recognizes that this is seriously unacceptable, reflects badly on their product AND service, and that it is their role to correct this. I expressed to the supervisor that my fear was receiving back the same troublesome unit, AGAIN, THAT THEY THEMSELVES HAD DAMAGED and was told basically to play ball and see how it goes. I also wrote a letter voicing my extreme dissatisfaction and again a request for a new unit to turn this experience around so that I could be able to write a favorable review. I just now have been informed that the problem has been fixed to "factory standards" and will be sent back to me. Not only has this camera been defective, it was damaged by their own repair staff. And in the 6 months that I've owned it, I have only been able to use it less than half the time. I let them know how they could repair my confidence, and was utterly dismissed. I can report that my best friend loaned me her camera, a CASIO brand, and not only has it worked perfectly, it has better settings, is more user friendly, and takes better shots. I WILL NEVER BUY ANYTHING NIKON AGAIN. CASIO GETS ALL MY $$$$.

Reviews.Title: Amazing...
Reviews.Author: Mikki
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as if 2-12-12 and as if 3-25-12 it does not work anymore? The camera quality was just okay. The touch screen was responsive. The video worked fine and so did the zoom, for the price I was not expecting an awesome camera but after a month it kicked the bucket? I am now searching on a way to get my camera fixed....very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: nice pics, but didn't last very long
Reviews.Author: d
Reviews.Content: Well the camera took beautiful pictures, but after one month it broke. This means it didn't respond to pushing any button and refused to recharge. So I sent it back. In conclusion I am quite disappointed by the camera's durability, though I might just picked the one bad apple in a tray of good ones...

Reviews.Title: Nikon messed up on this design
Reviews.Author: ARO
Reviews.Content: I have purchased and owned a number of these little cameras, but owned this one for less than 30 minutes.  Nikon made a serious error in switching from the normal button cursor for the menus to a touch screen interface.  What were they thinking?  This guarantees that the screen in which you are trying to compose your photo will be covered with finger prints!  In all the cameras I own (nearly all Nikon) I try really hard to avoid touching either the view finder or the display screen.  If I am bothering to take a photo of something there is usually a detail that I need to be sure is accurately portrayed.  That just isn't possible with a screen that is full of smeared finger prints.  I have also discovered from my touch screen phone that wiping the screen has all sorts of unintended results.  (My briefcase frequently makes phone calls as well.)  Touch-screen technology is not the right thing for a camera.  I purchased a slightly older coolpix s6000 instead.  I had purchased 2 of them in the last six months for others I work with and knew that the quality was perfect for my uses and that the control mechanisms were more appropriate to a camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Jackie Samborn
Reviews.Content: The camera doesn't work , I have charge it for 3 days still doesn't work the light when charging is suppose to be lite is not lighting up.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money!
Reviews.Author: Christina Shwed
Reviews.Content: This camera is great, the only reason I give it a 4 star is the flash could be quicker and it is not great with movement, but it's a great camera otherwise!

Reviews.Title: Easy and quick - good photos
Reviews.Author: Catherine Matthias
Reviews.Content: For a carry around camera this one can't be beat. Easy to use, easy to download and the photos while not professional quality are good enough for the family photo album, website, or research subjects.

Reviews.Title: hard to use
Reviews.Author: Flaglady
Reviews.Content: probably just me, but I NEVER could figure out how to use this camera!  It just didn't work for me, will not buy another Nikon.

Reviews.Title: a handy, low-cast pocket cam.
Reviews.Author: Anders Tronsen
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend buying one new if a used seller claims Good or Very Good condition (my good luck?)this is a stop-gap purchase for me Until I can afford a GPS cam.I've taken worthwhile vids of close-up action that others appreciated, that was fun!

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: Gail Langmeier
Reviews.Content: I had a camera just like this one and , after quite a few years of using it, it quit working.  I really like how user-friendly this camera is so I bought another one exactly the same as my first one.  Love it!

Reviews.Title: Extremely unhappy with my purchase!
Reviews.Author: Maria Velasquez
Reviews.Content: This camera did not come with the original charger and I have not been able to find a charger for it so I have not used it.  I was very unhappy with this purchase.  I bought it for Comic Con 2013 and did not use it at all.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX S6100 16 MP Digital Camera with 7x NIKKOR Wide-Angle Optical...
Reviews.Author: inga
Reviews.Content: Nikon COOLPIX S6100 16 MP Digital Camera with 7x NIKKOR Wide-Angle Optical...That's great!It is very, very good. I am happy with the purchase!My expectations justified

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera
Reviews.Author: DMac "donnamac317"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera. My pics are used on Pasty.net, ( [...] ) printed in the local newspaper, etc. This camera is phenomenal. I had one like it before, it went through the washer, and I was able to dry it out and keep using it! But, I dropped it one too many times, and finally broke it for good. I replaced it immediately with the same one. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this camera!~

Reviews.Title: This camera deserves zero stars
Reviews.Author: Emma
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a few years ago right before my last child was born. we used to take take every picture of our daughters birth and for the first two weeks of her life. when i went to upload the pictures the second i connected the camera into the computer a window popped up about formatting and then cleared all of the photos. it cost us $500 to get 90% of the photos restored. shortly after this the camera just stopped working. doesn't charge doesn't turn on. The camera made me so mad i tucked it away in a box and forgot to post a review but i recently just came across it and decided that maybe i can still prevent something from having to go through what this stupid camera put us through.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera!
Reviews.Author: Felipe Telles
Reviews.Content: Very good indeed but the battery just discharge whithin a few days without using... so you have to set it up again all the time...

Reviews.Title: 2nd one I owned
Reviews.Author: Dale Huling
Reviews.Content: I broke the first one that I owned.  Purchase this one in like a day or two and it arrived in working condition.  Great Camera - easy to use and battery last long time.  Shot some video with it and lots of picture.  Good pictures.

Reviews.Title: unhappy with vamera
Reviews.Author: papa john
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a Christmas present for my wife last year based on a Nikon that I have had for over four years. The one I had prior to this one has been dropped from ladders and other places but still is working great. Thinking on those basis I purchased another Nikon Coolpix and after doing so the battery life goes down real quick and I took it back to the store and the salesman sold me another battery for it at a discount. This worked out for her purposes but last week we were on vacation and we took a pictures and then the camera just stopped working, it will not turn on or off. The lens is stuck outward so I replaced the battery and still will not turn on or off, tried to plug it straight in the wall adaptor still nothing. I am very upset with the quality of the camera since Nikon use to be the top of the line in cameras so I did not mind paying a little more for it but I think that I will go back to the under $100.00 models and if they only last a year so be it I am not out a bunch of money. I would not recommend any of the Nikon lines since they will not work with you on the problems with the models no matter where you bought them.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX S6100
Reviews.Author: Steve C Wilson
Reviews.Content: We love this camera!If you are looking for more helpful reviews and information about the Nikon COOLPIX S6100, visit our website at http://www.nikoncoolpixs6100.org/

Reviews.Title: Some Lag time, otherwise it's a nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Laura "Laura"
Reviews.Content: I enjoy taking wild life photo's, so, this got to be a frustration. If your have people pose, you'll be fine.  It's hard to capture wild life and they don't pose.  It does have a continuous setting, so, you can have some luck with that.  I ended up buying the P510 by Nikon, and love it!

Reviews.Title: A pretty decent camera
Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty decent camera. It has good zoom and the pictures come out pretty well. And it's pretty simple to use.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: mando
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the camera it showed up quickly and is already in great use with my growing son and all the family adventures

Reviews.Title: Nice small Camera
Reviews.Author: Robert C. Bys "bobinma"
Reviews.Content: The charger did not last long, I had purchased 2 batteries. The factory made me pay for the simple part replacement.

Reviews.Title: The pictures are not sharp. Lot of shake in many pictures
Reviews.Author: Shopper
